column4: there is a .ebuild for gentoo to add the Canon iP2200 printer (compile) but I don't know how to use it in Ubuntu. I have an jackalope and64 installation, and I cannot print to my Canon iP2200. Can anyone assist?
or help, whatever
does that thing even compile on a 64 bit system?
(were you in here earlier asking about the same driver?)
link me to the ebuild?
(preferably include the "m" too :)
as I thought, compiles a 32 bit package. I don't know where the corresponding 32 bit libraries live in ubuntu.
(you keep doing "zz: ..." where you want to do "mzz: ..." to trigger my hilight...)
that ebuild compiles a 32 bit driver
sorry, your nick appeared on my screen as a square and two z's sorry :)
your font must be horrible :P
well, anyway
I've looked everywhere to find how I can compile these drivers, but I'm no Linux guru, so all this is unsettling
most of the answers are for x86, but nothing for amd64 except Turboprint... (ew)
they are not good drivers. It would probably be better if gutenprint supports this printer (I'd expect it to in the future)
I certainly hope so. how hard could it be? as one have said, it's merely a text file
I would edit it if I had some base... and time :)

(I have compiled them on a 32 bit system, they're part binary blob (which is why they won't compile as a 64 bit app) and the part that isn't blob is lacking decent error handling, so the results of running a miscompiled driver are confusing)
("confusing" in a "hey, why is my system running so slowly? Oh, there's a stale driver process attempting and failing to spawn some other process as quickly as it can" way)
hehe
well, thanks for your help. I'll keep on using my wife's computer (windows) to print stuff :(
because you know, if /usr/local/bin/whatever doesn't exist, obviously attempting to spawn it a few million times will make it exist!

despite it all, I'm glad that Ubuntu runs stable enough on this Studio XPS 16. My other system was an Inspiron 5150, and was horribly unstable, so I was forced to use XP. I won't complain too much about a stupid Canon driver :)
